intro: Aneilema setiferum var. pallidiciliatum, commonly known as the pale-stemmed aneilema, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence known as a spadix, surrounded by a spathe. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle, aiding in water retention in its native habitat. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a unique structure that facilitates pollination by insects. This variant is distinguished by its pale green stems and foliage, setting it apart from other members of the species.
